meanings.definition: Not having or showing prejudice or bias.
meanings.sent1: She always tries to be unbigoted when meeting new people.
meanings.sent2: It is important to be unbigoted when making decisions about others.
meanings.sent3: The unbigoted approach to different cultures makes for a more harmonious society.
meanings.sent4: Her unbigoted view of the world was like a breath of fresh air.
meanings.sent5: The unbigoted attitude of the teacher made the classroom a welcoming place.

meanings.sent1: He approached the situation with an unbigoted mind.
meanings.sent2: Being unbigoted allows for greater understanding and acceptance.
meanings.sent3: The unbigoted way he looked at the world was both refreshing and enlightening.
meanings.sent4: Her unbigoted heart embraced diversity with open arms.
meanings.sent5: The unbigoted perspective of the group led to innovative solutions.
